title: API Key

subtitle.text5: about their status. Here you can generate and manage API Keys to be used to authenticate the organisation's requests.

error-fecth-api-keys: Could not retrieve list of API Keys
copy-the-api-key: To allow integration, copy the code and enter it into the organisation's proprietary platform.
view-groups-id: Groups associated with the API Key {{apikey}}
view-groups-id-message: If you need to change them, generate a new API Key and replace the secret in the organisation's platform. Then, lock and delete this API Key.
block-warning1: If you lock {{apiKeyName}}, any requests made through this API Key will fail.
block-warning2: You can activate it again at any time.
rotate-warning1: By rotating {{apiKeyName}}, you deactivate the existing API Key and generate a new one with the same attributes.
rotate-warning2: After you have inserted the new API Key into the organisation's platform, lock and delete the rotated version.
enable-warning: If you activate the API Key {{apiKeyName}}, it can be used again. You can lock it again at any time.
delete-warning: If you permanently delete the API Key {{apiKeyName}}, it cannot be activated and used again.
copy-api-key-info: Copy the code and enter it into the organisation's platform.
empty-message: No API Key has been generated for this organisation yet. <0>Generate API Key</0>.

new-api-key.cancel-prompt: If you exit, you will lose all data entered so far. To generate a new API Key, you'll need to start over.
new-api-key.page-description: SEND generated the API Key code. Now, enter an identifying name and assign it to one or more groups.
new-api-key.form-error-name: Define a name for the API Key
new-api-key.form-label-groups: Choose the groups to which to assign the API Key
new-api-key.form-error-groups: Please select at least one group
